definition: a shortened form of a written word or phrase used in place of the whole word or phrase
sentence: The abbreviation is very important.

definition: helpful, obliging, polite
sentence: Though the apartment was not big enough for three people, Arnold, Mark, and Zebulon were all friends and were accommodating to each other.

definition: the science of human beings; especially : the study of human beings and their ancestors through time and space and in relation to physical character, environmental and social relations, and culture
sentence: She studied anthropology to understand different cultural practices around the world.

definition: a notice of approval or recognition
sentence: Jared received a commendation from Linda, his supervisor, for his stellar performance.

definition: existing during the same time
sentence: Though her novels do not feature the themes of Romanticism, Jane Austen’s work was contemporaneous with that of Wordsworth and Byron.

definition: stubbornly disobedient : rebellious
sentence: Was warned that any contumacious conduct would not be tolerated.

definition: astounded
sentence: Whenever I read an Agatha Christie mystery novel, I am always flabbergasted when I learn the identity of the murderer.

definition: incapable of expressing oneself clearly through speech
sentence: Though he spoke for over an hour, the lecturer was completely inarticulate and the students had no idea what he was talking about.

definition: hopelessly tangled or entangled
sentence: Unless I look at the solution manual, I have no way of solving this inextricable problem.

definition: the act or process of making a machine, a service, etc., ready to be used in a certain place : the act of installing something
sentence: The cable company offers lower prices and free installation.

definition: an act of interrupting something or someone or the state of being interrupted: such as
sentence: Our conversation continued without interruption for over an hour.

definition: incapable of being taken back
sentence: The Bill of Rights is an irrevocable part of American law.

definition: the act or an instance of placing two or more things side by side often to compare or contrast or to create an interesting effect; also : the state of being so placed
sentence: The juxtaposition of Holly's career with the content of her podcast might leave audience members scratching their heads.

definition: having information, understanding, or skill that comes from experience or education : having knowledge
sentence: The knowledgeable atmosphere made everyone comfortable.

definition: of, relating to, or involving mathematics
sentence: The mathematical atmosphere made everyone comfortable.

definition: tastelessly showy and falsely attractive
sentence: Sereni's poetry is quiet, musical, slightly melancholy most of the time, devoid of meretricious ornament.

definition: of or relating to method or methodology
sentence: The researcher used a methodological approach to analyze the data.

definition: exhibiting or marked by parsimony; especially : frugal to the point of stinginess
sentence: Despite his wealth, the parsimonious billionaire refused to donate to any charities.

definition: of or relating to pathology
sentence: A pathological examination led to the diagnosis.

definition: of acute mental vision or discernment : keen
sentence: The perspicacious detective immediately noticed the subtle clues others had completely missed.

definition: charitable, giving
sentence: Many people felt that the billionaire’s decision to donate her fortune to house the homeless was the ultimate philanthropic act.

definition: a natural liking for something : a tendency to do or to be attracted to something —often + for
sentence: She followed her own predilections.

definition: a state in which you give all your attention to something—usually + with
sentence: We need better preoccupation in this process.

definition: occupying the mind to the exclusion of other thoughts or feelings
sentence: His prepossessing appearance made it impossible for me to think of anything else.

definition: the act of saying something in a public, official, or definite way : the act of proclaiming something
sentence: No one believed her proclamations of innocence.

definition: rapid increase in numbers or amount
sentence: The proliferation of smartphones has changed communication.

definition: a doctor who treats mental or emotional disorders : a doctor of psychiatry
sentence: The psychiatrist had great importance in our daily lives.

definition: a method of explaining and treating mental and emotional problems by having the patient talk about dreams, feelings, memories, etc.
sentence: The psychoanalysis had great importance in our daily lives.

definition: a scientist who specializes in the study and treatment of the mind and behavior : a specialist in psychology
sentence: The psychologist was the topic of much discussion.

definition: marked by or concerned about precise accordance with the details of codes or conventions
sentence: The punctilious accountant checked every receipt three times before submitting the expense report.

definition: of or relating to how much there is of something : of or relating to the quantity or amount of something
sentence: The quantitative atmosphere made everyone comfortable.

definition: obstinately defiant of authority or restraint : stubbornly uncooperative or disobedient
sentence: The touch switches for the heater and the air conditioner can be recalcitrant as well.

definition: not showing proper concern about the possible bad results of your actions
sentence: The product received recklessness reviews from customers.

definition: the act of remembering something or the ability to remember something
sentence: Her recollection of the accident is very different from mine.

definition: the act of saying that someone or something is good and deserves to be chosen
sentence: My boss wrote me a glowing letter of recommendation.

definition: the action, process, or result of rehabilitating or of being rehabilitated: such as
sentence: MCL injuries alone rarely necessitate surgery and heal with rest and rehabilitation.

definition: the idea or belief that people are born again with a different body after death
sentence: The reincarnation contributed significantly to the community.

definition: the act of renouncing something or someone
sentence: The king's renunciation of the throne.

definition: very bad : deserving very strong criticism
sentence: Such reprehensible acts.

definition: reacting in a desired or positive way
sentence: The responsiveness atmosphere made everyone comfortable.

definition: a sound that echoes
sentence: The reverberation had great importance in our daily lives.

definition: morally good : following religious or moral laws
sentence: The product received righteousness reviews from customers.

definition: brilliantly lively, stimulating, or witty
sentence: The scintillating approach proved to be effective.

definition: not based in fact
sentence: Sadly, Tessa was convicted on merely speculative evidence.

definition: exceeding what is sufficient or necessary : extra
sentence: The superfluous approach proved to be effective.

definition: evasion of straightforward action or clear-cut statement : equivocation
sentence: The tergiversation was clearly visible from the window.

definition: sustained and bitter railing and condemnation : vituperative utterance
sentence: Understanding the vituperation requires careful study.

definition: of, relating to, or arranged in or according to the order of time; also : reckoned in units of time
sentence: His chronological age is five, but his mental age is three—he thinks and behaves like a three-year-old.

definition: supposed or assumed true, but unproven
sentence: Even though it has been celebrated by seven major newspapers, that the drug will be a success when tested in humans is still hypothetical.

definition: having or occurring in great variety : diverse
sentence: Participated in multifarious activities in high school.

definition: attracting or seeking to attract attention, admiration, or envy often by gaudiness or unnecessary show : overly elaborate or conspicuous
sentence: The ostentatious = very large and expensive summer homes of rich industrialists.

definition: adhering resolutely to an opinion, purpose, or design
sentence: Despite numerous rejections, the pertinacious writer continued submitting her manuscript to publishers.

definition: of, relating to, or based on philosophy
sentence: They got into a philosophical debate about what it means for something to be natural.

definition: having no pity : cruel or merciless
sentence: The ruthlessness atmosphere made everyone comfortable.

definition: coolly and patronizingly haughty
sentence: Reacted to their breach of etiquette with a supercilious smile.

definition: done, made, or acquired by stealth : clandestine
sentence: The surreptitious approach proved to be effective.

definition: marked by vainglory : boastful
sentence: The vainglorious actor constantly boasted about his awards and refused to praise others.

definition: a counting device with beads or disks
sentence: She used an abacus to do math.

definition: deserted or forsaken
sentence: The old house stood in ruins, abandoned and forgotten.

definition: act of abandoning or being abandoned
sentence: The abandonment of the project caused disappointment.

definition: to embarrass or make ashamed
sentence: He was abashed by his mistake in front of the entire class.

definition: the act of reducing or lessening
sentence: The company received a tax abatement for eco-friendly initiatives.

definition: a slaughterhouse for animals
sentence: The abattoir processed hundreds of cattle every day.

definition: a monastery or convent
sentence: The monks gathered in the abbey for their evening prayers.

definition: the superior of an abbey or monastery
sentence: The abbot led the monks in their daily rituals.

definition: the act of abdicating or giving up power
sentence: The abdication of the queen shocked the nation.

definition: the region of the body between the chest and the pelvis
sentence: He felt a sharp pain in his abdomen.

definition: the act of kidnapping or taking by force
sentence: The police launched a search operation after the abduction.

definition: intense disgust or hatred
sentence: His abhorrence of violence led him to become a pacifist.

definition: completely opposed or repugnant
sentence: His behavior was considered abhorrent by society.

definition: a place where one lives or resides
sentence: Her abode was a cozy cottage in the countryside.

definition: to scrape or wear away by friction or erosion
sentence: The rough surface abraded his skin.

definition: a localized collection of pus in a body tissue
sentence: The dentist had to drain the abscess in his patient's tooth.

definition: not present or in attendance; missing
sentence: The teacher marked him absent for failing to come to class.

definition: the habit of regularly being absent from work or school
sentence: The company implemented measures to reduce absenteeism.

definition: the principle or practice of absolute power or authority
sentence: The king ruled with absolutism, making all decisions himself.

definition: the process of absorbing or being absorbed
sentence: The absorption of nutrients occurs in the small intestine.

definition: the quality of being easily reached or used
sentence: The new shopping mall prided itself on its accessibility.

definition: music or an instrument that supports or accompanies a soloist
sentence: The pianist played a beautiful accompaniment to the singer.

definition: familiar with or used to something; adapted to circumstances
sentence: He was accustomed to the cold weather after living in Alaska.

definition: to declare someone not guilty of a charge
sentence: The jury reviewed the evidence and decided to acquit.

definition: having an irritatingly strong and unpleasant taste or smell
sentence: The acrid odor of smoke filled the room.

definition: an abbreviation formed from the initial letters of other words
sentence: NATO is an acronym for the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

definition: to make something active or operational; to start or initiate
sentence: She activated the alarm system before leaving the house.

definition: the policy or action of using vigorous campaigning
sentence: She dedicated her life to environmental activism.

definition: a short, wise saying or proverb
sentence: A penny saved is a penny earned is a well-known adage.

definition: able to adjust or change according to needs
sentence: The software was designed with an adaptive interface.

definition: capable of causing addiction; compelling and difficult to give up
sentence: Video games can be highly addictive for some people.

definition: to cite as evidence or proof of an argument
sentence: The lawyer adduced several witness testimonies to support her case.

definition: a substance used for sticking objects or materials together
sentence: He used adhesive to glue the pieces of the broken vase.

definition: a word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun
sentence: Beautiful, red, and tall are examples of adjectives.

definition: serving as a warning or caution
sentence: He gave her an admonitory look, signaling that she was crossing a line.

definition: the legal process of taking another person's child as one's own
sentence: The couple went through the adoption process to expand their family.

definition: the stage of life when a person has reached full development
sentence: She embraced the responsibilities that come with adulthood.

definition: a word that modifies or adds information to a verb
sentence: Quickly, very, and well are examples of adverbs.

definition: difficulties or hardships; misfortune
sentence: Despite facing numerous adversities, he never lost hope.

definition: the activity or profession of producing advertisements
sentence: He works in advertising and creates campaigns for clients.

definition: a person who has a deep appreciation for art
sentence: The art gallery attracted many aesthetes.

definition: a matter or situation that is of concern or importance
sentence: The financial affairs of the company were being investigated.

definition: a positive or emphatic statement or declaration
sentence: The coach provided words of affirmation to boost confidence.

definition: inexpensive or reasonably priced; within one's financial means
sentence: They were able to find an affordable apartment in the city.

definition: to make a problem, situation, or condition worse
sentence: The loud noise aggravated his headache.

definition: the ability to move quickly and easily
sentence: The athlete's agility allowed him to navigate obstacles.

definition: relating to farming or agricultural activities
sentence: The region's economy was primarily agrarian.

definition: assistance or support; help
sentence: The organization provides aid to those affected by disasters.

definition: loyalty or commitment to a person or cause
sentence: The citizens pledged their allegiance to the flag.

definition: a story or poem with a symbolic meaning
sentence: The novel was an allegory for political corruption.

definition: a portion or share assigned to someone
sentence: Each team member received an equal allotment of time.

definition: to suggest or indirectly refer to something
sentence: The professor made a clever remark that alluded to history.

definition: the state of having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas
sentence: He experienced ambivalence about accepting the job offer.

definition: sufficiently or generously
sentence: The hotel staff amply accommodated the needs of guests.

definition: in a frenzied or uncontrolled manner
sentence: The protesters ran amuck through the streets, causing chaos.

definition: lacking in vitality, strength, or substance
sentence: The company's sales were anemic, struggling to generate revenue.

definition: a substance that causes loss of feeling or sensation
sentence: The dentist administered an anesthetic before the procedure.

definition: attributing human characteristics to non-human things
sentence: In children's literature, anthropomorphic animals play main roles.

definition: playful or silly act or gesture; clownish behavior
sentence: The comedian's antic had the audience laughing uncontrollably.

definition: directly opposed or contrasted; mutually incompatible
sentence: His actions were antithetical to the values he claimed.

definition: highest point; culmination or climax
sentence: The team's victory was the apex of their season.

definition: self-assurance or confidence in poise
sentence: Despite facing a challenge, the leader handled it with aplomb.

definition: a person who renounces a belief or cause
sentence: He was labeled an apostate after publicly renouncing his affiliation.

definition: short, concise, and witty saying
sentence: The elder shared an apothegm that had been passed down.

definition: a ghostly figure or supernatural appearance
sentence: She claimed to have seen an apparition in the old haunted house.

definition: noticeable or significant amount
sentence: There has been an appreciable increase in tourists since airport.

definition: expressing approval or praise
sentence: The teacher gave an approbatory smile to the hardworking student.

definition: related or belonging to something as an accessory
sentence: The document contained an appurtenant appendix.

definition: to settle a dispute or conflict as an arbitrator
sentence: The judge was appointed to arbitrate the labor dispute.

definition: belonging to or characteristic of the aristocracy
sentence: The elegant mansion reflected the aristocratic status.

definition: a formal agreement to cease fighting or war
sentence: The armistice marked the end of hostilities.

definition: complete or utter; notorious or egregious
sentence: The politician's arrant disregard for ethics brought outrage.

definition: ambitious and ruthless social climber
sentence: The arriviste businessman was willing to do whatever it took.

definition: clever or cunning, especially in a deceitful way
sentence: The artful politician knew how to manipulate the crowd.

definition: dominance or control; a position of power or influence
sentence: The company's ascendancy in the market was evident.

definition: with suspicion or disapproval
sentence: She looked askance at his extravagant purchase.

definition: to express agreement or approval
sentence: The committee members assented to the proposed changes.

definition: amazing or astonishing in a surprising way
sentence: Her performance was astounding, leaving audience in awe.

definition: extremely cruel, brutal, or wicked
sentence: The prisoners were subjected to atrocious treatment.

definition: to provide evidence or testify to the truth of
sentence: Several witnesses attested to the defendant's innocence.

definition: clothing or apparel
sentence: The guests were expected to dress in formal attire.

definition: the act of attributing or ascribing something
sentence: The journalist failed to provide proper attribution.

definition: to predict or foreshadow something
sentence: The dark clouds augur an approaching storm.

definition: strictness or severity, especially in terms of living
sentence: The country imposed austerity measures to combat crisis.

definition: having the power or right to give orders
sentence: The professor's authoritative voice commanded attention.

definition: exercising complete or absolute control; dictatorial
sentence: The autocratic leader made all decisions without consulting.

definition: acting or functioning independently, without control
sentence: The self-driving car operates autonomously.

definition: eager or enthusiastic about something
sentence: He was an avid reader, devouring books of all genres.

definition: to assert or confess openly
sentence: He avowed his love for her in front of everyone.
